This topic applies to Windows XP Service Pack 1 or later.
The VMRVideoDesc structure describes a video stream to be deinterlaced.

member.name: VMRVideoDesc.dwSize
member.summary: Size of the structure, in bytes.

member.name: VMRVideoDesc.dwSampleWidth
member.summary: Width of the video to be deinterlaced, in pixels.

member.name: VMRVideoDesc.dwSampleHeight
member.summary: Height of the video to be deinterlaced, in pixels.

summary.para: Specifies one of the following values.

listheader.description: Each field is delivered as a separate sample.
Pairs of fields are combined into single samples.

member.name: VMRVideoDesc.dwFourCC
member.summary: Specifies a FOURCC code. Valid values include NV12, YV12, YUY2, UYVY, IMC1, IMC2, IMC3 and IMC4

member.name: VMRVideoDesc.InputSampleFreq
member.summary: A [VMRFrequency](/windows/win32/api/strmif/ns-strmif-vmrfrequency structure that specifies the input frequency. For NTSC TV, the frequency would be expressed as 30,000:1001.

member.name: VMRVideoDesc.OutputFrameFreq
member.summary: A structure that specifies the output frequency. For NTSC TV, the frequency would be expressed as 60,000:1001.
